com.ftdichip.ftd2xx

Class Device

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ftdichip.ftd2xx.Device

  • public class Device
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the Device to access a particular the ft2xx device (e.g. FT232BM).

    Example: Accessing device descriptor information. 
     Device[] devices = Service.listDevices();
 Device device = devices[0];
 
 device.open();
 
 DeviceDescriptor descriptor = device.getDeviceDescriptor();
 
 System.out.println(desc.getManufacturer());
 System.out.println(desc.getSerialNumber());
 System.out.println(desc.getProductDescription());
 
 device.close();

    Compatibility with the native ftd2xx-API:
    • The function FT_SetChars(...)is not supported. It does not fit into the current design.
    • The parameter names of FT_SetUSBParameters(...)are renamed for more clearness.
    • Events are currently not supported
    Author:
    Mike Werner

    • Constructor Detail

      • Device

        protected Device(long locationID,
      long deviceType)
          throws FTD2xxException
        Creates a new Device. The device descriptor is read from the EEPROM.
        Parameters:
        locationID - the device`s location within the USB tree.
        deviceType - the native device type code.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the device can not be accessed.

        Retrieves the resetPipeRetryCount.
        Returns:
        the resetPipeRetryCount.

      • setResetPipeRetryCount

        public void setResetPipeRetryCount(long resetPipeRetryCount)
                            throws FTD2xxException
        Sets the new resetPipeRetryCount. The resetPipeRetryCount controls the maximum number of times that the driver tries to reset a pipe on which an error has occurred. In noisy environments, where a lot of USB errors occur, it may be necessary to increase the default value of 50.
        Parameters:
        resetPipeRetryCount - the new value (32 bit).
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the new value can not be set.

      • getModemStatus

        public ModemStatus getModemStatus()
                           throws FTD2xxException
        Retrieves the current modem status of this device.
        Returns:
        the status.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the status can not be retrieved.

      • getLatencyTimer

        public int getLatencyTimer()
                    throws FTD2xxException
        Retrieves the current value of the latency timer.

        Note: this method is only valid for FT232BM and FT245BM devices.
        Returns:
        the latency timer value.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the value can not be retrieved.

      • setLatencyTimer

        public void setLatencyTimer(int value)
                     throws FTD2xxException
        Sets the new latency timer value for this device.
        Parameters:
        value - the new value in milliseconds. The value range is 1 - 255.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the value can not be set.

        the mode value.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the mode can not be retrieved.

      • setBitBangMode

        public void setBitBangMode(int bitMask,
                  BitBangMode mode)
                    throws FTD2xxException
        Sets the Bit Bang Mode to use.
        Parameters:
        bitMask - 8 bit mask to specify which pin shall serve as an input (0) and which one shall be an output pin (1).
        mode - trueselects the Bit Bang Mode .
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the value can not be set.

      • resetBitBangMode

        public void resetBitBangMode()
                      throws FTD2xxException
        Resets the Bit Bang Mode .
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the the device can not be accessed.

      • setUSBParameters

        public void setUSBParameters(long rxBufferSize,
                    long txBufferSize)
                      throws FTD2xxException
        Sets the USB transfer sizes of this device.
        Parameters:
        rxBufferSize - the receive buffer size (32 bit).
        txBufferSize - the transmit buffer size (32 bit).
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the parameters can not be set.

      • read

        public int read()
         throws FTD2xxException
        Reads one byte. This method blocks until at least one byte is available.
        Returns:
        the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the byte can not be read.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buffer)
         throws FTD2xxException
        Reads all the data in the receive queue. If no data is available, it blocks until one was received or the end of the stream was detected. This method has the same effect as read(buffer, 0, buffer.length).
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to store the data in.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes read.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the operation can not be performed.

      • read

        public int read(byte[] buffer,
       int offset,
       int length)
         throws FTD2xxException
        Reads reads a specified number of bytes. If no data is available, it blocks until one was received or the end of the stream was detected.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer to store the data in.
        offset - the index within the buffer of the first byte to store.
        length - the number of bytes to read.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes actually read, or -1 if the end of the stream was detected.
        Throws:
        FTD2xxException - if the operation can not be performed.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Retrieves this device`s InputStream. This intended for applications that use standard Java I/O for communication.
        Returns:
        the input stream.

        public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Retrieves this device`s OutputStream. This intended for applications that use standard Java I/O for communication.
        Returns:
        the output stream.
